intro: Heinsenia sylvestris, commonly known as the wild heinsenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Heinsenia sylvestris is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
